content:
The development of characters in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure has a significant impact on the overall story and themes of the series. The characters' growth and evolution contribute to the overarching narrative by driving the plot forward, highlighting the consequences of their actions, and revealing the complex motivations behind their behavior.

One of the main themes of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is the importance of family and the bonds that connect people. The development of the characters reinforces this theme by showcasing how their relationships with one another change and evolve over time. For example, in Part 3, Jotaro's journey to save his mother from a curse leads him to form deep connections with his traveling companions, ultimately teaching him to trust and rely on others.

Another significant theme in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is the exploration of power and its corrupting influence. As the characters gain more abilities and strength throughout the series, they must wrestle with the question of how to use that power responsibly. The development of the characters underscores this theme by showing how their actions have consequences and highlighting the ways in which individuals can become corrupted when they pursue power at all costs.

Overall, the development of the characters in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure serves to enrich the series' themes and reinforce its message about the importance of human connections and responsibility.
